page.title: 15MRS.MEEKE'S MEMORIES.
page.content: Mrs. Meeke has lived in Rushall for over seventy years. She moved into Rushall when she was nine. She remembers the time when there was a fire station in Daw End Lane and a police station opposite the wine bar. The fire station had only one fire engine. She can remember when Rushall had its own registrar. When anyone was born or when anyone died their name had to be registered. Now the nearest police station and fire station is in Aldridge and the registrars office is in Walsall. In the middle of Rushall was a weighbridge where carts and their loads could be weighed.There was also a trough for the horses to drink from and a clock. All of these have now gone.
